decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a combo using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Urza's Saga to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage. It aims to quickly ramp into powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge, while also utilizing cards like Time Vault and Tinker for additional win conditions. The deck also includes disruption and protection elements with Force of Will and Trinisphere. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently assembling key pieces and overwhelming the opponent with powerful artifact synergies.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and efficient card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recast certain permanents from the graveyard. The deck also features powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Time Vault, along with key lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on using a combination of efficient control spells and disruptive elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and eventually win the game through the Time Vault and Manifold Key combo. It employs powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Timetwister along with mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and the Moxen to quickly establish board presence and control the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds resilience and recursion to the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing Bazaar of Baghdad to fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. This allows for quick graveyard recursion and combo potential with cards like Creeping Chill, Prized Amalgam, and Hollow One. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection while cards like Narcomoeba and Ichorid allow for additional value and pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, along with disruption like Force of Will and Force of Vigor to control the game and pressure the opponent. It also includes powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck has a mix of graveyard interaction with Deathrite Shaman and Life from the Loam, along with a versatile removal spell in Assassin's Trophy. The mana base is built to support the three colors of BUG while also including disruption like Wasteland and Strip Mine.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman. It also incorporates disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to control the game. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Force of Vigor and maintain card advantage with card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm. By combining aggression with disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing interaction and disruption to control the game, while also generating card advantage through various spells and artifacts. The deck includes powerful cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor to provide control and consistency. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. Additionally, the deck features powerful artifact mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key for alternate win conditions.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing hatebears and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Chancellor of the Annex, and Chalice of the Void. It aims to control the board with disruptive creatures while utilizing Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox to ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Strip Mine to further disrupt the opponent. Overall, the key concept is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient threats.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and land destruction to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Nettlecyst to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the game by locking down the opponent's resources with cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere, while also having the ability to generate additional mana and card advantage with cards like Mishra's Workshop and Mystic Forge. The deck's main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and prevent them from enacting their game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns, along with disruptive elements such as Collector Ouphe and Force of Will to control the game. It also includes powerful card advantage spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to ensure a steady stream of resources. By combining efficient threats with disruptive spells, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to victory in a variety of matchups.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex. It also includes hate cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent. The deck has a strong mana base with powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen, allowing for quick deployment of threats. The goal is to apply pressure while preventing the opponent from executing their strategy effectively, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the card Underworld Breach to cast multiple spells from the graveyard in a single turn, allowing the player to generate a large amount of card advantage and potentially win the game on the spot. The deck includes various cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, as well as powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to help dig for combo pieces. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts. It aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland, Strip Mine, and Sphere of Resistance while also utilizing artifact mana acceleration like Mishra's Workshop and Moxen to power out threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem. The deck also includes cards like Null Rod and Phyrexian Revoker to shut down opposing artifact strategies, making it difficult for the opponent to effectively respond to the aggressive threats presented by the deck.

This deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo by using powerful draw and search spells like Ponder, Preordain, Brainstorm, and Demonic Tutor to set up the perfect sequence of cards. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. Thassa's Oracle is the win condition, with cards like Ancestral Recall and Necropotence providing additional card advantage. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently assemble the necessary pieces to win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on fast mana acceleration through Moxen, Sol Ring, and Mana Crypt to quickly play powerful spells like Time Vault and Tinker to win the game. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will, Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, and Hullbreacher to control the opponent's plays. The deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain control of the game through card draw with Sensei's Divining Top and Ponder, while also shutting down opposing strategies with cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Pithing Needle. The Azorius Initiative archetype emphasizes proactive play and disruption to secure a victory.

This deck relies on a combination of powerful spells and efficient disruption to control the game and outmaneuver opponents. Utilizing a mix of Moxen for fast mana acceleration, along with a versatile suite of counterspells and removal, the deck seeks to protect its key combo pieces like Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By efficiently using resources and adapting to different matchups, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and maintain control over the game until it can secure a win condition.
